greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of unlabeled asymmetric 7-ary cacti having n polygons.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..200
Miklos Bona, Michel Bousquet, Gilbert Labelle, Pierre Leroux, Enumeration of m-ary cacti, Advances in Applied Mathematics, 24 (2000), 22-56 (pdf, dvi).
Index entries for sequences related to cacti
formula: a(n) = (1/n)*(Sum_{d|n} mu(n/d)*binomial(7*d, d)) - 6*binomial(7*n, n)/(6*n+1) for n > 0. - _Andrew Howroyd_, May 02 2018
mathematica: a[n_] := DivisorSum[n, MoebiusMu[n/#] Binomial[7#, #]&]/n - 6 Binomial[7n, n]/(6n + 1);
program: (PARI) a(n) = if(n==0, 1, sumdiv(n, d, moebius(n/d)*binomial(7*d, d))/n - 6*binomial(7*n, n)/(6*n+1)) \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, May 02 2018
results.author: _Simon Plouffe_
ext: Terms a(11) and beyond from _Andrew Howroyd_, May 02 2018
